title: Georgi Makhatadze
text:
Georgi Aleksandrovich Makhatadze (; born 26 March 1998) is a Russian <a href="association%20football">football</a> player who plays as a <a href="defensive%20midfielder">defensive midfielder</a> for <a href="FC%20Rotor%20Volgograd">Rotor Volgograd</a>.
Club career.
He made his debut in the <a href="Russian%20Premier%20League">Russian Premier League</a> for <a href="FC%20Lokomotiv%20Moscow">FC Lokomotiv Moscow</a> on 21 May 2016 in a game against <a href="FC%20Mordovia%20Saransk">FC Mordovia Saransk</a>.
On 24 August 2018, he was released from his contract with <a href="FC%20Rubin%20Kazan">FC Rubin Kazan</a> by mutual consent.
On 28 August 2018, he rejoined Lokomotiv, and was assigned to the farm-club <a href="FC%20Kazanka%20Moscow">FC Kazanka Moscow</a>.
On 11 June 2021, he moved to <a href="FC%20Rotor%20Volgograd">Rotor Volgograd</a> in the <a href="Russian%20Football%20National%20League">FNL</a>.
International.
He represented <a href="Russia%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">Russia national under-17 football team</a> in the <a href="2015%20UEFA%20European%20Under-17%20Championship">2015 UEFA European Under-17 Championship</a>, in which he was selected for the team of the tournament, and later in the <a href="2015%20FIFA%20U-17%20World%20Cup">2015 FIFA U-17 World Cup</a>, in which he scored twice against <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">South Africa</a>.
